RECORD.TEXT: 807558580 EH 82952093 321002 8/26/1993 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed DIS Admission Date : 08/26/1993 Report Status : Signed Discharge Date : 08/29/1993 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : FIBROID UTERUS STATUS POST MYOMECTOMY . OPERATIONS / PROCEDURES : MYOMECTOMY , 08/26/93 . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This is a 30 year old Gravida I , Para I , status post cesarean section in 03/93 for a fibroid uterus and transverse lie of the fetus . The patient was unable to have intercourse postpartum secondary to fibroid in vagina and secondary to severe pain . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Significant for manic depressive illness in the past . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Status post cesarean section . MEDICATIONS : Prozac . ALLERGIES : No known drug allergies . Patient does not smoke . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : Patient was afebrile , vital signs stable . HEENT exam was normal . Breasts without masses . Lungs were clear . Heart was regular rate and rhythm without murmur . Abdomen was soft with well healed Pfannenstiel incision . Pelvic exam , vagina and cervix normal . Uterus was non-tender , approximately 12 week size with a posteriorly felt fibroid at 10 cm . Guaiac negative . HOSPITAL COURSE : Patient underwent a myomectomy on 08/26/93 . Operative findings included a 10 cm fundal fibroid which was adhered to the cul-de-sac . There were normal ovaries and tubes otherwise . The fundal fibroid was connected to the fundus of the uterus by a 3-4 cm stalk . Of note , the patient can have a vaginal birth after cesarean section with her next pregnancy . Postoperative course was unremarkable . Patient advanced her diet well and was discharged on postoperative day # 3 on 08/28/93 . DISPOSITION : MEDICATIONS : Percocet one to two po q 4 hours p.r.n. , and Prozac . Patient will follow with Dr. Pain in two weeks post discharge .
